abstract: Thousands of new police officers deployed in Ukraine are one of few visible signs of reform since government was overthrown; novice officers will join older ranks, collectively known as militia, and anticipated mix has some residents wondering whether new officers' milder, less confrontational style will be successful in reforming behavior of officers as a whole.
lead_paragraph: The new patrol officers, whose training emphasizes public service, are being held up as a tangible sign of change in a corrupt criminal justice system.

headline.main: Ukraine Pins Hopes for Change on Fresh-Faced Police Recruits
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Pins Its Hopes for Change on a Youthful Crop of Police Recruits

snippet: The new patrol officers, whose training emphasizes public service, are being held up as a tangible sign of change in a corrupt criminal justice system.
